body:
I agree: it would be beneficial to the community to add such advice in [Migration Tips](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#migrating-from-junit4-tips).

@Marcono1234, would you like to submit a PR for that?

Hi @sbrannen and @Marcono1234, if you are ok with this I'd like to improve the documentation adding to [migration-from-junit4.adoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/main/documentation/src/docs/asciidoc/user-guide/migration-from-junit4.adoc) the entry:

- The following assertions now accept the assertion message as their last parameter: `assertTrue`, `assertFalse`, `assertNull`, `assertNotNull`, `assertEquals`, `assertNotEquals`, `assertArrayEquals`, `assertSame`, `assertNotSame` and `assertThrows`.

@rob93c, I think it's fine if you submit a PR, since @Marcono1234 has not volunteered to.

However, I think we should add more text than just that. We should state how it worked in JUnit 4 and how it works in JUnit Jupiter, and we should show an example from each framework for comparison -- for example, using `assertEquals(String, String, String)`.

issue.title: Document new failure message argument position in JUnit 4 migration tips

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
See #2809.

## Overview

<!-- Please describe your changes here and list any open questions you might have. -->

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass

body: Sorry for not having responded yet. Thanks a lot @rob93c for taking on this task, your PR looks really good!

rename.from: JUnit 4 migration tips should mention switched assertion message position
rename.to: JUnit 4 migration tips should document switched assertion failure message argument position
